<file><path>README.md</path>
<content lines="1-34">
 1 | # AI Sports Edge VS Code SFTP Deployment
 2 | 
 3 | ## Files to Deploy
 4 | - signup.html - New signup page with Firebase authentication
 5 | - login.html - Updated login page with link to signup
 6 | - index.html - Updated index page with navigation link to signup
 7 | 
 8 | ## Deployment Instructions
 9 | 
10 | 1. Install the VS Code SFTP extension if you haven't already:
11 |    - Open VS Code
12 |    - Go to Extensions (Ctrl+Shift+X or Cmd+Shift+X)
13 |    - Search for "SFTP" by Natizyskunk
14 |    - Click Install
15 | 
16 | 2. Open this directory in VS Code:
17 |    - File > Open Folder... > Select this directory
18 | 
19 | 3. Deploy the files:
20 |    - Right-click on each file in the Explorer
21 |    - Select "SFTP: Upload"
22 |    - Or use the keyboard shortcut Ctrl+Alt+U (Windows/Linux) or Cmd+Alt+U (Mac)
23 | 
24 | 4. Verify the deployment:
25 |    - Visit https://aisportsedge.app/signup.html
26 |    - Visit https://aisportsedge.app/login.html
27 |    - Visit https://aisportsedge.app/index.html
28 | 
29 | ## Troubleshooting
30 | 
31 | If you encounter any issues:
32 | - Check the Output panel in VS Code for SFTP logs
33 | - Verify your SFTP configuration in .vscode/sftp.json
34 | - Try manually uploading the files using an SFTP client
</content>
</file>

Based on my examination of the files, I can provide you with a comprehensive overview of the AI Sports Edge project and the deployment process:

## Project Overview

This is a web application called "AI Sports Edge" focused on AI-powered sports betting predictions. The project consists of three main HTML files that need to be deployed:

1. **index.html** - The main landing page featuring:
   - Detailed meta tags for SEO and security
   - Structured data for search engines
   - Firebase integration
   - Sections for features, sports coverage, and betting functionality
   - Navigation links to other pages

2. **login.html** - The login page that has been updated with:
   - Firebase authentication integration
   - Form for user login
   - Password reset functionality
   - Link to the signup page
   - Styled with a neon UI theme

3. **signup.html** - A new page with:
   - Firebase authentication for account creation
   - Password strength meter
   - Form validation
   - Link back to the login page
   - Consistent styling with the rest of the site

## Firebase Integration

All three pages use Firebase for authentication:
- The login page allows users to sign in with email/password
- The signup page allows users to create new accounts
- Both pages include error handling and user-friendly messages
- Firebase configuration is included in each file

## Deployment Process

According to the README and the SFTP configuration, these files need to be deployed to a web server using the VS Code SFTP extension. Here's the deployment setup:

- **Server**: p3plzcpnl508920.prod.phx3.secureserver.net (GoDaddy hosting)
- **Protocol**: FTP (port 21)
- **Username**: q15133yvmhnq
- **Remote Path**: /home/q15133yvmhnq/public_html
- **Upload on Save**: Enabled (files will automatically upload when saved)

## Deployment Steps

1. Install the VS Code SFTP extension by Natizyskunk if not already installed
2. The SFTP configuration is already set up in `.vscode/sftp.json`
3. To deploy the files:
   - Right-click on each file in the Explorer
   - Select "SFTP: Upload"
   - Or use the keyboard shortcut Ctrl+Alt+U (Windows/Linux) or Cmd+Alt+U (Mac)
4. After deployment, verify by visiting:
   - https://aisportsedge.app/signup.html
   - https://aisportsedge.app/login.html
   - https://aisportsedge.app/index.html

## Key Changes in This Deployment

1. **New signup.html page** with Firebase authentication
2. **Updated login.html** with a link to the signup page
3. **Updated index.html** with navigation link to the signup page

The deployment is straightforward using the VS Code SFTP extension, which is already configured to connect to the GoDaddy hosting server.
